_exec_summary.SummaryText:
-Executive Summary
This Risk Management Plan (RMP) has been prepared for the chlorine system at the City of Chicopee Water Treatment Plant located in Chicopee, Massachusetts.  This Plan has been developed in accordance with Title 40 of the Code of Federal Regulations, Part 68, "Chemical Accident Prevention Provisions".  The purpose of these provisions and this RMP is to prevent accidental releases of toxic and flammable substances that can cause harm to the public and to the environment.
This RMP was originally developed by the City of Chicopee Water Treatment Plant consultant Tighe & Bond specifically to prevent and mitigate accidental releases associated with storage and handling operations at the Chicopee facility.  The RMP provides a summary of the risk management program implemented at the City of Chicopee Water Treatment Plant and was developed following the Environmental Protection Agency's guidance documents for the regulated chemicals.  The RMP is available to government agencies and the public for review.
Tighe & Bond has performed the requisite review and regulatory update necessary for covered facilities on their five year RMP Submission Anniversary.  This review included:
* A hazard analysis of the covered process using a methodology involving checklists developed from EPA RMP Guidance, as well as a physical inspection of the covered process;
* Performance of an off site consequence analysis (OCA) taking into account data revised from the year 2000 census; and
* A general review of operating and maintenance procedures with facility operations and environmental personnel.
The following items provide and overview of the City of Chicopee Water Treatment Plant's RMP, in accordance with 40 CFR 68.155.
-Facility Description and Covered Process
City of Chicopee Water Treatment Plant stores up to 8,000 pounds of chlorine for water treatment.  The chlorine is stored in a room equipped with ventilation and chlorine alarms.  The chlorine gas is mixed with water in

the chlorinators and is directly injected into the treatment locations.
-Release Scenarios
A worst case release scenario and two alternative release scenarios were performed and documented in the original RMP filing.  These scenarios were recalculated for the five year anniversary updating population and receptor information.  Based on guidelines provided by EPA in the 2004 RMP Submit Instruction Manual, release scenario information is not provided in this Executive Summary.
-Administrative and Engineering Controls
City of Chicopee Water Treatment Plant has implemented a prevention program (RMP Program 2) to administratively limit the potential for a worst case or alternative release.  No passive measures, however, were taken to minimize the impacts of these releases.  Specific measures employed in this program include safety reviews, hazard reviews, operating procedure reviews, training and maintenance and inspection.  These reviews are conducted, consistent with the operation of the covered process, once (1) every three (3) years in association with City of Chicopee Water Treatment Plant Compliance Audit (40 CFR 68.58) or with major changes.  The hazard review is required every five (5) years or with major changes.  Maintenance and inspection is conducted at specified intervals as outlined in City of Chicopee Water Treatment Plant's RMP.  The results of the most recent reviews are also maintained at the facility.
-Mitigation Measures
Certain engineering controls are used to mitigate the potential effects of the alternative release scenarios and are listed in Section 8.4.d of the RMP submittal.  
-General Accidental Prevention Program and Chemical Specific Prevention Items
City of Chicopee Water Treatment Plant has implemented a Program 2 RMP to prevent the release of toxic substances that can cause harm to the public and the environment.  Program 2, in general, consists of the following:
* Safety Information (Sect. 68.48)
* Hazard Review (Sect. 68.50)
* Operating

Procedures (Sect. 68.52)
* Training (Sect. 68.54)
* Maintenance (Sect. 68.56)
* Compliance Audits (Sect. 68.58)
* Incident Investigation (Sect. 68.60)
* Emergency Response Program (Sect. 68.90)
This Program 2 RMP has been implemented at the facility and City of Chicopee Water Treatment Plant maintains a copy available for review on-site.
-Five Year Accident History
There have been no reportable releases of chlorine at City of Chicopee Water Treatment Plant in the five (5) years preceding the submission of this RMP.
-Emergency Response Program
City of Chicopee Water Treatment Plant has coordinated its Emergency Response Program (ERP) with appropriate agencies as required under 40 CFR 68.90 to include the following activities:
* A public meeting and/or notification was made to the general public relative to chlorine stored at the facility.
* The Federal Bureau of Investigation was notified of the meeting date and location.
* Appropriate agencies were provided with ERP information such as City of Chicopee Water Treatment Plants ERP, offsite consequence analysis, prevention measures, etc.
* Tier II reports are submitted to appropriate agencies on an annual basis to periodically update facility emergency response information.
-Safety Improvements
The following list provides a summary of items implemented at City of Chicopee Water Treatment Plant in association with this Plan that are designed to improve safety.
* Safety Review (Audit every 3 years)
* Hazard Review (Audit every 3 years, update every 5 years)
* Operating Procedures Review (Audit every 3 years)
* Training (Audit every 3 years, training once every 3 years (minimum))
* Maintenance and Inspection (conducted annually, audit every 3 years)
* Emergency Response Program (coordination with local emergency personnel)
A Process Hazard Analysis update was conducted at the City of Chicopee Water Treatment Plant and involved operations, management and environmental personnel.  The updated analysis identified some minor
recommendations that will be implemented within the next year.
